result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher T Swan

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Michael Thurston in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney John Paul Marchan appeared by video for Christopher T Swan. 
Defendant Christopher T Swan appeared by video. 
Attorney Marchan indicates that this case will be a waiver of the preliminary hearing.
Attorney Marchan requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:15 AM   File not called on the record.
Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher T Swan in court by zoom with attorney John Paul Marchan. 
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Marchan requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:43 AM   File not called on the record.
Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher T Swan in court by zoom with attorney John Paul Marchan by zoom.
Attorney Marchan requests another hearing date.  Court grants.
  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court sets a signature bond in the amount of $1,000
CONDITIONS:
Court will allow for contact between the defendant and his two younger brothers.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
No contact with co-actor listed in case 20CF1791.
No unsupervised contact with any one under the age of 18 years old.

Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher T Swan in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Victim A appeared by zoom.

Attorney Marchan was court appointed on case 20CF1791 and is requesting the appointment be continued to include case:  22CF214.
Court Grants - Court will continue the court appointment for 20CF1791 to include case 22CF214.

Defense acknowledges receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.

State presented their bail arguments.
Defense presented their bail arguments.

Court sets a signature bond in the amount of $1,000
CONDITIONS:
Court will allow for contact between the defendant and his two younger brothers.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
No contact with co-actor listed in case 20CF1791.
No unsupervised contact with any one under the age of 18 years old.

Defense will waive the time limits.
Defense is requesting the matter be scheduled back in front of Judge Melvin to address scheduling of the prelim or waiver.

Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on March 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
